σπάργᾰν-ον, τό,
(σπάργω) band for swathing infants, [Refs 5th c.BC+]: mostly in plural, swaddling-clothes, [Refs 5th c.BC+]; ἐκ πρώτων σ. ab incunabulis, [Refs 2nd c.AD+]; τὰ τῆς γεννήσεως εὐτελῆ σ. a mean origin, [Refs 2nd c.AD+] —hence,
__2 in Trag. and Comedy texts, objects left with an exposed child, the marks by which a person's true birth and family are identified (Latin crepundia, monumenta), [Refs 5th c.BC+]; so probably τούτου (i.e. τοῦ Τηλέφου) δὸς.. μοι τὰ σ. [Refs 5th c.BC+]
__II a plant,= ὠκιμοειδές, falsa lectio for{σπαργάνιον}, Ps.-[Refs 1st c.AD+]
